group_1.textCenter: …Hmnn… What is…this sound I hear…?@It’s very…soothing…

group_1.textRight: Naaaayuuuutaaan!!
Phew…@You’re finally awake.

group_1.textLeft: Rabi…@…What is that thing in your hand?

group_1.textRight: These are sleigh bells, a type of musical@instrument.

group_1.textLeft: Wow, they sound rather Christmas-y.

group_1.textRight: Yes, since today is the 25th of December.
I figured I’d use something evocative of@Christmas to wake you up.

group_1.textLeft: It certainly gets you in the spirits.

group_1.textRight: Although, because you still refused to wake up,@the muscles in my arms are exhausted.
…I’m afraid I will not be using this to wake@you up anymore.

group_1.textLeft: Oh no…but it made such a pleasant sound…

group_1.textRight: Oh dear, Mikage is waiting outside.
Please wash your face and brush your teeth@quickly.

group_1.textLeft: U-understood…
You’ve arrived much earlier than usual@today.
It’s not time for our morning snacks@just yet.

group_1.textRight: Well, we didn’t get to play at all@during Christmas Eve, right?
So I came here right after eating breakfast@to make up for it.

group_1.textLeft: So that’s your reason.
So, what should we entertain ourselves with? If@it’s your winter homework, I’ll gladly have a look.

group_1.textRight: C’mon, Nayutan, now's not the time to be@worrying about that.
Nayutan, can you transform real quick?

group_1.textLeft: …?@[wait:1.0][chara:103701:lipSynch_1]I suppose.

group_1.textRight: See? We still look like this.

group_1.textLeft: Of course, we had Yozuru and Sudachi@change our forms
into Befana, Christmas sorceresses.

group_1.textRight: So y’know, Su-tan said it’s gonna turn@back to normal today.
She said it'd be way too inconvenient to@use for everyday stuff.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, is that so?

group_1.textRight: But it’s such a waste though! I don’t care@what it is, let’s do something!
I wanna do something Befana would do!

group_1.textLeft: ...Mikage, are you the type who becomes interested@when something is labeled as limited edition?
Well, that's fine. Let's join forces
and follow the path of Befana together.

group_1.textRight: Thank you, Nayutan!

group_1.textLeft: But that begs the question, what would being@“Befana-like” entail...?

group_1.textRight: Why not simply put your personal magic to use?
If you can uncover the stories and feelings@carried by people’s gifts,
depending on how you use it,@you might be able to help someone in need...

group_1.textLeft: While it is true that we have such power,@I’m afraid that's not quite right.
Our personal magic is but a direct result of@what we sought after during Coordination...
So it doesn't seem to have anything to do@with actual Befana...

group_1.textRight: Now that you mention it, that’s true.
What was the Befana like in her story again?

group_1.textLeft: As we talked about before, she was a@sorceress who delivered treats.

group_1.narration: “Befana, in search of the Son of God,@uses a bright star as her guiding light@as she delivers gifts of baked goods@to people's stockings...”

group_1.textLeft: That’s the basics of how her tale goes.

group_1.textRight: Thanks!
Hmmm...@Now how do we be “like” her...?

group_1.textLeft: Shall we keep it simple and make some@treats to hand out…?

group_1.textRight: …Incredible! Nayutan, you’re a genius!@That’s it!
We'll make a bunch of homemade treats@and give them to everyone!
Do you intend on making them immediately? I'll@have to procure the ingredients then…

group_1.textLeft: Don’t worry, by my estimates,@we’ll be done just in time.

group_1.textRight: I’m not sure if the estimates of someone who@never steps foot in the kitchen are valid…

group_1.textLeft: I’m confident we’ll be able to hand all of@them out by mid-afternoon.

group_1.textRight: Mii knew that coming straight here right after@breakfast was the right move.

group_1.textLeft: One might even call it fate.

group_1.textRight: Okay, so we gotta go buy the ingredients@first.
To the shopping mall we gooo!
